meanings.definition: The quality of being able to spread or transmit a disease.
meanings.sent1: The infectiousness of the flu made it spread quickly through the school.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the infectiousness of the virus was a cause for concern.
meanings.sent3: The infectiousness of the yawn passed around the room, causing everyone to start yawning.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an infectiousness that brightened up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The infectiousness of the rumor grew, becoming more exaggerated with each retelling.

meanings.definition: The state of being contagious or capable of causing infection.
meanings.sent1: The high infectiousness of the disease led to a quarantine being imposed.
meanings.sent2: The nurse emphasized the importance of understanding the infectiousness of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The infectiousness of his laughter was so contagious that even the grumpiest person couldn't help but smile.
meanings.sent4: The infectiousness of her enthusiasm spread to everyone in the room, inspiring them to join in.
meanings.sent5: The infectiousness of his charisma drew people to him like a magnet.
